abstract: The General Electric Company’s Japanese consumer lending unit said it would close 60 percent of its branches and cut 15 percent of its employees as part of a restructuring plan. The GE Consumer Finance Company, a Tokyo-based lender, will shut 73 of its 115 branches and 200 of its 1,342 unmanned outlets, the firm said. The company said it would also cut as many as 400 employees out of 2,600 by the end of June.

lead_paragraph: The General Electric Company’s Japanese consumer lending unit said it would close 60 percent of its branches and cut 15 percent of its employees as part of a restructuring plan. The GE Consumer Finance Company, a Tokyo-based lender, will shut 73 of its 115 branches and 200 of its 1,342 unmanned outlets, the firm said. The company said it would also cut as many as 400 employees out of 2,600 by the end of June.

headline.main: Japan: G.E. Lending Unit Scaling Back
headline.print_headline: Japan: G.E. Lending Unit Scaling Back
